question: 快い
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>pleasant</kanji>? It is also <vocabulary>pleasant</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word's reading is pretty weird. We're going to think back to a couple different words to put this one together. The word for heart (<ja>心</ja>), is <ja>こころ</ja>. The word for good is <ja>よい</ja> (or <ja>いい</ja>, but for this word's sake, <ja>よい</ja>). A "good heart (feeling)" is one where your heart feels nice and warm and fuzzy (figuratively, not literally. If it's literal, go to the hospital please). That is a <vocabulary>pleasant</vocabulary> feeling. A <ja>こころよい</ja> feeling.
